info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 11:29PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Chesterfield, southeastern Cumberland, Prince Edward, northwestern Lunenburg, Nottoway, northwestern Dinwiddie and Amelia Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1129 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Morven to Jetersville to near Crewe. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Farmville, Blackstone, Crewe, Amelia Courthouse, Mannboro, Hampden Sydney, Hampden Sydney College, Longwood University, Nottoway, Burkeville, Morven, Spainville, Green Bay, Jetersville, Wilsons, Scotts Fork, Rice, Chula, North Wellville and Angola. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
